message.content:
It is challenging to provide an accurate summary of what "most men" in Mongolia think of abortion, as opinions on this topic can vary significantly among individuals. However, it is important to note that Mongolia, like many other countries, consists of diverse populations with a range of opinions and perspectives on abortion.

In general, attitudes towards abortion can be influenced by cultural, religious, and personal beliefs. Mongolia has a predominantly Buddhist population, and Buddhism generally discourages the intentional taking of any human life. However, societal views on abortion in Mongolia have evolved over the years due to various factors such as urbanization, globalization, and increased access to information.

While there may be men in Mongolia who strongly oppose abortion due to religious or moral reasons, some others might hold more liberal views, recognizing a woman's right to make decisions regarding her own body. In recent years, there has been increased awareness and debate around women's reproductive rights and the importance of accessible and safe reproductive healthcare.

It is worth noting that opinions on abortion can differ within any society, and it would be incorrect to assume that all men in Mongolia share a uniform perspective. Understanding individual viewpoints requires considering various factors like educational background, personal experiences, exposure to different perspectives, and personal values.
